dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: ...and honestly, like, for them to say the facade work on Station 101 is already, uh, 100% complete? That’s, that’s huge, B.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...and honestly, like, for them to say the facade work on Station one hundred one is already, uh, one hundred percent complete? That's, that's huge, B.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to CTS, the facade work at station „–101 is 100% complete.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Huge? A, it's one facade. For one station. We're talking about, what, eighteen stations total here? It's hardly a milestone, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huge? A, it's one facade. For one station. We're talking about, what, eighteen stations total here? It's hardly a milestone, is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It should be noted that the LRT line includes a total of 18 stations with multi-level halls and platforms, which are divided into two types: ground (11 stations) and above-ground (7 stations).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: But it's progress! And, um, they've got, like, interactive screens and escalators, even elevators for accessibility. It's not just some bare concrete shell.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's progress! And, um, they've got, like, interactive screens and escalators, even elevators for accessibility. It's not just some bare concrete shell.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Inside the 101 station, located along Kabanbay Batyr Avenue in the area of Astana International Airport, there are escalators and interactive screens showing footage of the capital. ... There are elevators inside, which passengers can use to go up to get on the train or go down to go out into the city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Interactive screens that probably won't work in six months, A. And elevators? Uh, that's standard for any modern transport hub. This isn't groundbreaking stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interactive screens that probably won't work in six months, A. And elevators? Uh, that's standard for any modern transport hub. This isn't groundbreaking stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but the fact that they're targeting full completion for all stations by 2025, that's a deadline, you know? The Akim even revealed it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but the fact that they're targeting full completion for all stations by twenty twenty five, that's a deadline, you know? The Akim even revealed it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2025, it is planned to fully complete the construction of all stations... Astana Akim reveals deadline for LRT completion

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: 2025? A, we've been hearing deadlines for, like, a decade now. I'll believe it when I'm riding one of those, uh, "driverless" trains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: twenty twenty five? A, we've been hearing deadlines for, like, a decade now. I'll believe it when I'm riding one of those, uh, driverless trains.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, by the way, they're already assembling in Tangshan! Nineteen modern driverless trains, B. That's, that's pretty cutting-edge, you have to admit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, by the way, they're already assembling in Tangshan! Nineteen modern driverless trains, B. That's, that's pretty cutting-edge, you have to admit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Chinese city of Tangshan, they began assembling the first carriages for the Astana LRT. They are manufacturing 19 modern driverless trains there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Cutting-edge? Or just another way to cut corners on staffing and, um, human oversight? I'm not so sure about these, uh, driverless things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cutting-edge? Or just another way to cut corners on staffing and, um, human oversight? I'm not so sure about these, uh, driverless things.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Come on, it's efficient! And the stations are going to be, like, well-lit, lots of windows. It sounds really modern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Come on, it's efficient! And the stations are going to be, like, well-lit, lots of windows. It sounds really modern.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The building is well lit due to the large number of windows.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: "Sounds" modern. Yeah. They also "sounded" like they'd be finished years ago. I mean, they're just showing us one station near the airport. Who even uses that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sounds modern. Yeah. They also sounded like they'd be finished years ago. I mean, they're just showing us one station near the airport. Who even uses that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CTS transport company showed what one of the LRT stations will look like. Inside the 101 station, located along Kabanbay Batyr Avenue in the area of Astana International Airport...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says it's along Kabanbay Batyr Avenue. That's, uh, important.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says it's along Kabanbay Batyr Avenue. That's, uh, important.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Inside the 101 station, located along Kabanbay Batyr Avenue in the area of Astana International Airport...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Important for people at the airport, maybe. What about the rest of the city, A? Are we supposed to be impressed by some, uh, half-finished window dressing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Important for people at the airport, maybe. What about the rest of the city, A? Are we supposed to be impressed by some, uh, half-finished window dressing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Half-finished? The facades are 100% complete! That's what it says.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Half-finished? The facades are one hundred percent complete! That's what it says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: The facade, A. Not the whole station. Not the whole system. It's, it's just, like, a tiny piece of the puzzle, and they're acting like it's the whole picture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The facade, A. Not the whole station. Not the whole system. It's, it's just, like, a tiny piece of the puzzle, and they're acting like it's the whole picture.

dialogue_turns.text: But it means they are building it. It's real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it means they are building it. It's real.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
